resources.string: NFC is OFF, go to settings and turn it ON.
Tag has been formatted.\nTap again to save key.
Unable to format tag to NDEF.\nTry another tag.
Tag doesn\'t appear to support NDEF format.\nTry another tag.
Trouble formatting before saving key.\nTap again.
Can\'t find a valid Private Key on the NFC tag.\nTry another one.
This tag is empty.\nTry another one.
Activate NFC? If not, keys will be saved on device.
Tap NFC tag to save Private Key and delete it from your device.
Tap NFC tag to save Private Key on your device.
Keys have been successfully saved on your device.
Place QR code within box to scan message OR contact.
Place QR code within box to add contact.
Place QR code within box to read message.
Try sending the message again. You have not received a session ID from your contact.\n
Session has been reset, due to a possible attack or problem.\n
Session updated, everything is A OK.\n

A session identifier or session token is a piece of data that is used in network communications to identify a session, a series of related message exchanges. In SPEC, we want you to be sure that you\'re in touch with the correct contact and not an impersonator. Therefore it is vital to keep track of the current state of the conversation and a session ID is one way to achieve that goal.\n
SPEC generates a secret that the other side (contact) must decrypt and send back.
You both have the same session, so you\'re communicating with the same person as before.\n

You have a different session than your contact. 
It's possible that your contact is a fake, fraud. 
Your session is:
Your communications are secure, you\'ve seen this contact before.\n
First time you\'re receiving a message from this contact, verify identity (email).\n

A replay attack is a form of network attack in which a valid data transmission is maliciously or fraudulently repeated or delayed (after possible tampering). These attacks are mostly carried out by an adversary whom intercepts the data and retransmits it, possibly as part of a Man in the Middle Attack. SPEC verifies that this type of attack and similar ones aren\'t carried out.
No need to be worried about Replay Attacks.\nConversation just started.
Everything seems to be A OK.
Time-stamp is broken.\nDo not trust this message.
This message has been sent more than 60 hours ago.\nYou should be careful.
You\'ve already received a newer message from this contact.
we are checking the last time you received a message from this contact, and the day this message was created
messages came from QR may be taking longer to get to you.\nwe decide to give three parameters: now, in this week, in last two weeks, and old

The main application of secure cryptographic hashes is verification of message integrity - determining whether any changes have been made to a message or a file. SPEC verifies that your messages are secure and complete. WE FIGHT DATA TAMPERING 24/7.\n
to make the hash small we used xor of the entire bytes(divided for 4 bytes packets) that create an integer.\nby encrypting this integer inside the message we making it secure
You must have a Private Key in order to make changes.
Sorry.\nCan\'t attach file.\nCurrent limit is 50 MB.
Let the SPEC magic begin.\nStart bringing privacy and security to your online life.\nEnter email and swipe arrow to the left to generate keys.
SPEC ; HOLD THE KEY TO YOUR SECURITY.
Decrypt message using barcode scanner, press button to scan:\n
Tap NFC to store Private Decryption Key externally
Skip and save key on device
This message hasn\'t been encrypted for you.
An encrypted message just for you - SPEC MOBILE APP
Please enter a valid email.\nThis email will enable other users to contact you.
My Public Key - SPEC MOBILE APP
Would you like to approve this contact?\nAfter approval you\'ll be able to send this contact secure content.
Are you sure you want to delete this contact?
"You don\'t have any contacts.\nTo add contacts, share your Public Key under My SPEC, scan a contact\'s QR code or ask a contact to send you their Public Key (Contact Card) to your email.
Add this contact to your CONTACTS LIST first (press addition button).
Shared Contact Card, Recommendation - SPEC MOBILE APP

Sending a SECURE message:
------
1. Choose contact
2. Enter message
3. Add file (optional)
send both file and QR code via:
Name should be at least 3 characters long.
A contact with the same email already exists.\nDo you want to update their Public Encryption Key?
If you generate new keys, you will lose access to previous data that was encrypted with your Public Key. Think about it before pressing Next.
Verify that you understand the risk before continuing. You will not be able to decrypt and read previous messages or files.
There is no going back if you change your keys (in current Beta version).
Attached is a file containing the stack-trace causing the error.
Unexpected error. Would you like to send an error report to SPEC?\nThank you
For enhanced transparency and security, we\'ll generate various keys and let you choose the one that you want, by pressing the QR code below.
Feel free to send us suggestions and feedback. Add us to your contacts list by pressing the QR code.

invite a friend to the group
you sent your session, but didn\'t get one back yet from contact.
All your data has been restored.
we can\'t verify that this backup was created by you.\nsomeone could try to encrypt false data for you
Are you sure?\nby restoring your backup all other data you\'ve saved will be lost
Restoring the data will put you in the same position you left.
In order to make the backup save you must have the private key to create it
if your private key is on NFC, just tap it to device and the message will decrypt
you cannot add contact without an account/having public key on the device
\nor you can decrypt the message you want, and not save it at all
you cannot create a backup without having your public key

This function will backup your SPEC data (contacts, saved files and notes) in a secure fashion. The output of this funtion will be a protected file that you can later load into the SPEC app in order to retrieve your data.
There was a problem loading the file,\nit may have moved to a different location.
